intro: Darlingtonia californica f. viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered pitcher plant, is a rare and striking variant of the California pitcher plant. This cultivar is distinguished by its vivid green flowers, which contrast with the typical red or orange hues of the species. It belongs to the Sarraceniaceae family and is native to the foggy, cool climates of northern California. The plant features elongated, tubular leaves that trap insects, a feature typical of its genus. Its unique coloration makes it a prized specimen among carnivorous plant enthusiasts.
